name: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver Airport

reviews.title: Feel Welcomed
reviews.text: I went to Vancouver last month(6/2006) and spent 9 nights at Holiday Inn Vancouver Airport. We booked the kid's room with bunk bed in 3rd floor. The room was smaller than we expected but it was clean & quiet. The staffs were friendly and helpful. They have garage parking with private gate and its location is quiet convenient.
I would love to stay there again for my next visit .I feel welcomed there even though I have 3 small children with me.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean, Comfy

reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Vancouver Airport for two nights, during a somewhat spontaneous trip from Washington-state to Vancouver. We arrived cold, without prior reservations, having picked the location solely due to good experiences with HI Expresses in the past.
reviews.title: Decent hotel in good location

reviews.text: It was rather late when we checked-in, but we were able to do so quickly and without issue. Our room, though extremely clean and well-decorated, was rather small and squashed into a corner at a rather odd angle that effectively cut off a large portion of the space. Still, it served its purpose well enough.
reviews.title: Rude Manager

reviews.text: The next morning, we were better able to see our location. Richmond and its general vicinity is lovely, with access to lots of restaurants and stores, and the freeways that take you into downtown Vancouver (one of my favorite places, ever). The woman on duty our first morning provided us with a map of the city as well as some nearby restaurants for breakfast. It's right across from a Costco, so if you're a member, you can easily stock up on things for your trip that you may have forgotten.
reviews.title: Perfect for a quick visit

reviews.text: We stayed here on two separate (non-continuous) nights during our 10 day vacation around the Vancouver-Victoria area. We selected Richmond as a transition point during our 10 day vacation (e.g., after returning from Victoria by ferry, we overnighted here, en route to Whistler the next day). So we got a decent quality hotel at CAN120/night without paying downtown Vancouver rates.
reviews.title: Extremely clean, modern rooms, great beds

reviews.text: This was my first experience with the Holiday Inn Express brand and I can say that it won't be my last. The room was very modern and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and spotless.
reviews.title: Kid Suites above Parking Garage Door is Noisy and Small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I appreciated the free breakfast in the morning. Included were scrambled eggs, bacon, oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, bagels, fruit, 2% and skim milk, coffee, and tea.
reviews.title: Convneient for early AM flight

likes.disliked: — Lack of eating places for dinner and noise from Cosco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was an internet terminal in the breakfast area that cost approximately CAN4 dollars per 30 minutes.
reviews.title: It's ok if you need a hotel near the airport

reviews.text: The downside? There are not a lot of restaurants around the hotel, although on our 2nd visit, we were able to find a Moxies that was open until 11 pm (this was appreciated during our ferry trip back from Victoria, as our ferry was delayed leaving by 2 hours). If have a Costco card, there is a large Costco directly across from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Originally chose this hotel because of the Park and Fly package - one night stay gives you 7 days of parking, additional days at $5/day, free airport shuttle. The parking area is behind a locked chainlink fence and was secure (hotel staff open and close it). If you're flying out of YVR and have to overnight it's not a bad deal.
reviews.title: Convient But Overpriced

likes.liked: — Convient location, park and fly option
likes.disliked: — Extra costs over and above internet booking rate.

reviews.text: I booked on-line by clicking on the Park and Fly package icon (assuming that would give me the Park and Fly rate). Upon arrival I was informed that the rate I booked was the regular AAA rate, the Park and Fly package was actually ended up being $40 more than I expected - $177 compared to $135 ($15 of that was the additional 3 days of parking).
reviews.title: Perfect Spot for a quick stop near the Airport

likes.disliked: — The sheets, while clean, were rough.

reviews.text: The room was clean, well maintained, and comfortable. We had requested a crib and it was provided. The continental breakfast the following morning was pretty basic - Cosco muffins (Cosco located across the street so they were probably fresh), microwaved "omletes" with Cheese Whiz filling (boxes were being dropped off as we ate so these too were probably "fresh"), cereal, fresh fruit, etc.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed here twice - night before and night after an out-of-country flight.
reviews.title: Safe and comfortable

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable rooms; Close proximity to the ferry terminal
likes.disliked: — Breakfast bar that became hard to navigate in large crowd

reviews.text: Hotel staff very professional. Building and room were spotless.
reviews.title: Nice stay in a family room, but keep moving in the room...

reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 nights and had a very good experience. The room was very clean and comfy. The free continental breakfast was above average compared to other hotels. The breakfast area was large and there were attendants looking after it, therefore, very clean and quick refills on food. Very friendly and helpful staff at the front desk. We asked them daily travel information and they made their efforts to help us out. Although it may be a bit away from Vancouver city, it definitely is very close to airport. It is very close to the centre of Richmond too. We enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Richmond location after having previously stayed at the downtown Holiday Inn (on Howe street).
reviews.title: Poor location and Small rooms

reviews.text: The rooms at the Holiday Inn on Howe were positively huge when compared to this hotels.
reviews.title: Nice, clean but tight

aka: Holiday Inn Express Vancouver Airport Hotel Richmond
description: Stay at the Holiday Inn Express Vancouver Airport Hotel Our Richmond (Vancouver), BC hotel is conveniently located near the Vancouver International Airport in Richmond. Home of the 2010 Winter Olympic Games, the city is a hub of culture that will connect you to a plethora of superb attractions. Vancouver exists as a metropolitan refuge surrounded by natural beauty, bringing nature and civilization together. Our Vancouver Airport hotel is close to several sights and attractions like the 2010 Olympic Oval, Buddhist Temple, and the River Rock Casino. The Museum of Anthropology at the University of British Columbia, Granville Island, Gastown and the Steveston Fishing Village are other attractions we encourage travelers to see while staying in our hotel. Vancouver, Canada is a diverse and historic city where vacation dreams come to life. In this bustling metro, film, international trade and technology are all important industries. The versatility of the city presents many opportunities to corporate guests of our hotel. Our Vancouver travelers can rest assured that while staying on our executive floor, they will experience a relaxing, focused environment. During your visit to Vancouver (Richmond), enjoy our choice amenities including the complimentary Express Start Breakfast Bar, high-speed, wireless Internet access and free local calls at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel at the Vancouver Airport.
